page.title: 17PAPER INDUSTRY-LITTLE LEVER
page.content: Brown paper was first made at Creams Paper Mill in 1677 by James Crompton on a site which had already supported a water powered fulling mill for over 100 years. Now powered by electricity,and controlled by computers since 1981,Creams employs 120 men and 3 women on a continental type,4 shift system. Many types of corrugated paper liners are manufactured from 300 bales of waste paper a day,supplied mainly by charity collections.The liners are used for packing purposes nationwide and principal exports are to France. In 1977 Creams Tercentenary Festival was held,since when a five a-side football competition has been played annually between Little Lever schools for the Creams Trophy.
